content.en: Improved Prostate Cancer Diagnosis: New research shows that advanced imaging techniques using PET/CT scans and radioligands can greatly improve the accuracy of diagnosing and staging prostate cancer. These algorithms, such as 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT and PSMA-PET/CT, have been found to have better diagnostic performance compared to conventional imaging methods. They can predict progression-free survival, improve staging, and even influence treatment decisions, making them critical tools in the diagnosis and management of prostate cancer.
content.da: Forbedret diagnose af prostatakræft: Ny forskning viser, at avancerede billedteknikker ved hjælp af PET/CT-skanninger og radioligander i høj grad kan forbedre nøjagtigheden af diagnosticering og stadieinddeling af prostatakræft. Disse algoritmer, såsom 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT og PSMA-PET/CT, har vist sig at have bedre diagnostisk ydeevne sammenlignet med konventionelle billeddannelsesmetoder. De kan forudsige progression-fri overlevelse, forbedre stadieinddelingen og endda påvirke behandlingsbeslutninger, hvilket gør dem til kritiske værktøjer i diagnose og håndtering af prostatakræft.
